subject: Personal Finance
title: Externalities All Around
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Externalities All Around.

hook.text: A factory pollutes a river. The factory profits. The town downstream gets sick. That's an externality.

buildup.text: An externality is a cost or benefit imposed on a third party who didn't choose to be involved.

discovery.text: Negative externalities include pollution, noise, and traffic. Positive ones include education and vaccines.

twist.text: Markets ignore externalities. Without intervention, polluters pollute for free and education gets underfunded.

climax.text: Taxes on pollution and subsidies for education are attempts to price externalities into the market.

punchline.text: Not all costs show up on the receipt.

quiz.question: What is a negative externality?
options: A cost imposed on others who didn't choose to be affected
A loss reported on a tax return
A product that decreases in value
